intro: Gymnocline achilleifolia, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, legume-like seed pods. Gymnocline achilleifolia is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert habitats.
